geninfo.para: On all 9200, 9300 and 9400 Series vehicles built after June 1, 1994, complaints may be received concerning bumping or squeaking sounds coming from the hood area. These sounds are most likely the result of the hood vibrating and contacting the cowl. Also complaints of hood vibration and flutter may be received. These complaints are most likely due to the rear edge of the hood being too close to the cowl and/or an incorrect hood height adjustment. These conditions should be corrected for driver comfort and to prevent continued wear between the hood and cowl.

svcproc.title: SERVICE PROCEDURE
svcproc.para: Before adjusting the hood, be sure the chassis is on a level surface and the hood is mounted properly to the cab. If required, adjust the radiator to cowl dimension, square the cab on the chassis and adjust cab air ride. Refer to GROUP 16 in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual for Cab squaring and Cab Air Ride adjustment.

svcproc.title: REAR EDGE OF HOOD TOO CLOSE TO THE COWL

note.para: The hood-to-cowl adjustment dimension is 3/4 inch (19 mm) minimum.

caution.para: To prevent damage to the hood, be sure the hood assembly is supported on padded floor stands.

step1.para: Tilt the hood assembly to a 45 degree angle and support the tilted hood with a floor stand. Detach the support spring assemblies as follows:
Remove the cotter pins (and washers, if so equipped) ( Figure 1).

step2.para: Pull out the retaining pins that secure the support spring assemblies to the radiator mounting brackets ( Figure 1).

step1.para: Obtain four spacer blocks that are sized 3/4 X 1.0 X 24.0 inches (19 X 25.4 X 609.6 mm).
Place two of the hood to cowl spacer blocks on top of the hood guide plate ( Figure 2).
Carefully close the hood against the front of the spacer blocks.

Latch the hood on both sides. If the hood cannot be latched with the hood to cowl spacer blocks in place, loosen the hinge adjustment bolts ( Figure 3), as described in step 7, to allow the hood to rest against the front of the spacer blocks and be latched.

Loosen (to finger tight) the hinge adjustment bolts ( Figure 3) and push the hood forward at the hinge until there is a minimum of 3/4 inch clearance between the rear edge of the hood and the cowl. Use the other two hood to cowl spacer blocks to check the hood to cowl spacing on each side. Move each hinge independent of the other hinge until the horizontal and vertical hood-to-cowl dimension is a minimum of 3/4 inch.
When the hood-to-cowl dimension is properly set, and the bottom front edge of the hood is parallel to the line of the bumper, tighten the hinge adjustment bolts ( Figure 3).

note.para: The gap between the bottom front edge of the hood and the top of the bumper should be approximately 2.14 inches (54.39 mm).

Install the cotter pins that secure the support spring assemblies to the radiator mounting brackets ( Figure 1).

svcproc.title: TOP OF THE HOOD TOO LOW AT THE COWL

svcsubproc.title: 9200 Model (All) Rear Hood Locator Block Adjustment
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 9 for all Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Release the hood latches on each side of the hood and tilt the hood assembly enough to adjust the rear hood locator block ( Item 2). Support the tilted hood with a floor stand, if required.

Loosen the adjustment bolts ( Item 1) that secure the rear hood locator block ( Item 2)to the inside of the hood. Adjust the rear hood locator block downward ( Item 3)on the slotted holes to raise the top of the hood up and in alignment with the cowl ( Figure 8).
Hold the rear hood locator block ( Item 2) in place and tighten adjustment bolts ( Item 1).
Repeat this procedure for the other side.
Lower the hood to the closed position and latch hood on each side. Check the alignment of the top of the hood with the cowl ( Figure 8).
If further adjustment is required, repeat steps 1 through 5.

svcsubproc.title: 9300 and 9400 Models (After June 1, 1994) Rear Hood Guide Adjustment
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 10 for all Items in parentheses.
Adjust the hood up or down ( Item 7) at the rear hood guide ( Item 2).

step1.para: Release the hood latches on each side of the hood and tilt the hood assembly enough to adjust the rear hood guide ( Item 2). Support the tilted hood with a floor stand, if required.

Loosen the adjustment bolts ( Item 1) that secure the rear hood guide ( Item 2) to the inside of the hood. Adjust the rear hood guide downward ( Item 7) on the slotted holes to raise the top of the hood up and in alignment with the cowl ( Figure 8).
Hold the rear hood guide ( Item 2) in place and tighten adjustment bolts( Item 1).
Repeat this procedure for the other side.
Lower the hood to the closed position and latch the hood on each side. Check the alignment of the top of the hood with the cowl ( Figure 8).
If further adjustment is required, repeat steps 1 through 5.

svcsubproc.title: 9300 and 9400 Models (After June 1, 1994) Rear Hood Guide Support Adjustment
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 11 for all Items in parentheses.
Adjust the side of the hood in or out at the rear hood guide support ( Item 1) to align the side of the hood with the cab (Item 5).

step1.para: Reach under the fender extender/skirt ( Item 2), and loosen the two adjustment bolts ( Item 3) holding the bottom of the hood guide support ( Item 1) to the hood guide support bracket ( Item 4).
With the hood latched, push the bottom of the hood guide support ( Item 1) inward until the rear edge of the hood is even with the cab ( Item 5).
With the rear edge of the hood even with the cab, hold the hood guide support ( Item 1) in place and tighten the two adjustment bolts ( Item 3).
Repeat procedure for other side of the vehicle.
